text: [Music]
we don't have a lot of Democracy in
America today and we have the this
formal um sort of Institutions we have
representative government and and we
have a Bill of Rights but the fact is
that the representative government
doesn't work very well the the electoral
system is dominated by wealth uh and so
I mean for instance in up coming
presidential election uh PE most people
I speak to cannot find a candidate that
they like they have no choice the
candidates have been selected for them
and they have Republican or Democrat and
third party candidates don't have a
chance the political system therefore is
is very limited uh and even freedom of
speech and press which are supposedly
guaranteed in the Bill of Rights uh they
are very severely constricted by the
control of the press and the control of
of all of the Arenas of free speech uh
by huge corporations that control the
major television uh channels and control
of major newspapers so the sure we are
more democratic than an absolutist and
totalitarian state uh but we in the
United States are still quite a long way
from democracy and certainly a long way
from economic democracy uh because of
the control of the economy by
Corporation and the the tax structure
which is set up by an unrepresentative
Congress and approved by an a president
uh a tax structure which has so far
channeled the wealth of the country
towards the richest 1% of the population
